title: Spring `@RequestMapping` doesn't work with `quarkus-resteasy-reactive-qute`

labels.name: area/spring
labels.description: Issues relating to the Spring integration

body:
### Describe the bug

Quarkus version: upstream

`quarkus-spring-web` is not working anymore with `quarkus-resteasy-qute` due to dependency conflicts, so I have to move on to `quarkus-resteasy-reactive-qute`,  but this library doesn't support Spring `@RequestMapping` annotation without method (Is supported in previous versions).

Extensions involved:
```
<dependency>
            <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
            <artifactId>quarkus-spring-web</artifactId>
 </dependency>

<dependency>
            <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
            <artifactId>quarkus-resteasy-reactive-qute</artifactId>
</dependency>
``` 

Code example:

```
@RestController
public class SimpleController {

    @Value("${spring.application.name}")
    String appName;

    @Inject
    Template home;

    @RequestMapping(value = "/", produces = MediaType.TEXT_HTML)
    public TemplateInstance homePage() {
        return home.data("appName", appName);
    }
}
```
Stacktrace: 
```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal io.quarkus:quarkus-maven-plugin:999-SNAPSHOT:build (build) on project spring-web: Failed to build quarkus application: io.quarkus.builder.BuildException: Build failure: Build failed due to errors
[ERROR]         [error]: Build step io.quarkus.resteasy.reactive.server.deployment.ResteasyReactiveProcessor#setupEndpoints threw an exception: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Usage of '@RequestMapping' without an http method is not allowed. Offending method is 'io.quarkus.ts.spring.web.boostrap.web.SimpleController#homePage'
[ERROR]         at org.jboss.resteasy.reactive.common.processor.EndpointIndexer.createEndpoints(EndpointIndexer.java:256)
[ERROR]         at io.quarkus.resteasy.reactive.server.deployment.ResteasyReactiveProcessor.setupEndpoints(ResteasyReactiveProcessor.java:449)
[ERROR]         at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
[ERROR]         at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
[ERROR]         at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
[ERROR]         at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:566)
[ERROR]         at io.quarkus.deployment.ExtensionLoader$2.execute(ExtensionLoader.java:820)
[ERROR]         at io.quarkus.builder.BuildContext.run(BuildContext.java:277)
[ERROR]         at org.jboss.threads.ContextHandler$1.runWith(ContextHandler.java:18)
[ERROR]         at org.jboss.threads.EnhancedQueueExecutor$Task.run(EnhancedQueueExecutor.java:2449)
[ERROR]         at org.jboss.threads.EnhancedQueueExecutor$ThreadBody.run(EnhancedQueueExecutor.java:1478)
[ERROR]         at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:829)
[ERROR]         at org.jboss.threads.JBossThread.run(JBossThread.java:501)
[ERROR] Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Usage of '@RequestMapping' without an http method is not allowed. Offending method is 'io.quarkus.ts.spring.web.boostrap.web.SimpleController#homePage'
[ERROR]         at io.quarkus.spring.web.deployment.SpringWebProcessor$1.transform(SpringWebProcessor.java:174)
[ERROR]         at org.jboss.resteasy.reactive.common.processor.transformation.AnnotationStore.transform(AnnotationStore.java:98)
[ERROR]         at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap.computeIfAbsent(ConcurrentHashMap.java:1737)
[ERROR]         at org.jboss.resteasy.reactive.common.processor.transformation.AnnotationStore.getAnnotations(AnnotationStore.java:51)
[ERROR]         at org.jboss.resteasy.reactive.common.processor.transformation.AnnotationStore.getAnnotation(AnnotationStore.java:64)
[ERROR]         at org.jboss.resteasy.reactive.common.processor.EndpointIndexer.createEndpoints(EndpointIndexer.java:286)
[ERROR]         at org.jboss.resteasy.reactive.common.processor.EndpointIndexer.createEndpoints(EndpointIndexer.java:227)
[ERROR]         ... 12 more


```

The workaround is to use the annotation `@GetMapping(value = "/", produces = MediaType.TEXT_HTML)` or `@RequestMapping(value = "/", produces = MediaType.TEXT_HTML, method = RequestMethod.GET)`

This breaking change should be documented.
